document_title: Angina: A warning sign of a potential heart attack
subsection_content:
Depending on the cause of angina, doctors will have appropriate treatment methods. The main aim of treatment is to prevent and quickly relieve angina attacks; Limits further accumulation of atherosclerotic plaques, helping to prevent and slow disease progression; reduce the risk of myocardial infarction.
Some treatments used to treat angina:
When you have chest pain due to a heart attack, your doctor will prescribe pain relievers and drugs to limit heart damage. If medications do not control your angina, your doctor will prescribe some surgical interventions to keep your heart muscle alive, such as coronary angiography and stenting or bypass surgery.; Surgical repair if you have an aortic dissection.; Acid blockers if your chest pain is caused by stomach acid refluxing into the esophagus.; Antidepressants if chest pain occurs due to panic attacks.
Exercise is very important for people with angina.
